channel.title: Plz read this and help me :(
channel.description: i wanna run my server but everytime i try to theres an error here it is BTW im using windows xp LOL [img]http://i54.tinypic.com/5b8g8o.jpg[/img]

item.title: Plz read this and help me :(
item.dc:creator: @own_master own master
item.description:
@own_master wrote:

dwarvenknight:

make sure you compile and run the server with the same version of JDK.

this my compilers code:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
and this is my runeservers code:

@echo off color 81 title Dragon-History java -Xmx500m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
i think their not on jdk what do you think?

Read full topic

item.source: Plz read this and help me :(

item.title: Plz read this and help me :(
item.dc:creator: @own_master own master
item.description:
@own_master wrote:

[quote=“Snackman, post:2, topic:379016”] that simply means you need to update JDK to newer OR older version.
I got Java JDK 1.6.0_20, and it works fine for me.
But back on topic:
You will just need to update or downgrade your JDK version. The class files (files you get when you compile .java will also get .class :P) can’t be read by your JDK. They don’t recognize the files, so that means you got a higher version than needed, or a lower version.

Hope this helped [/quote]
thanks but i don’t think thats the problem because it worked fine on my laptop (it has windows 7) but non of the servers are working on my friends PC

Read full topic

item.title: Plz read this and help me :(
item.dc:creator: @Snackman Snackman
item.description:
@Snackman wrote:

that simply means you need to update JDK to newer OR older version.
I got Java JDK 1.6.0_20, and it works fine for me.
But back on topic:
You will just need to update or downgrade your JDK version. The class files (files you get when you compile .java will also get .class :P) can’t be read by your JDK. They don’t recognize the files, so that means you got a higher version than needed, or a lower version.

Hope this helped
